page.title: 11Work at Langford School
page.content: The children do Mathematics nearly every day. They work from text books which have the problems set out for them and they have to work out the answers.The older children have to learn their tables.(eg.6 x 7 =42).The children also do maths while doing Topic Work or some form of problem solving. Calculators are sometimes used to help the children. Every term the children in each of the classes do their Topic Work.For this they will have to study History, Geography and Science. They might take a theme like Transport and look at many different aspects of it especially those which are in their own area.They would make visits to places and write about what they saw.They would look things up in books and watch programmes on the television about their theme. Their work might go on the class walls.
